Package io.curiositycore.thecuriositycore.database.mysql.queries

Enum Class SqlDataTypes

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<SqlDataTypes>
io.curiositycore.thecuriositycore.database.mysql.queries.SqlDataTypes
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<SqlDataTypes>, Constable
public enum SqlDataTypes extends Enum<SqlDataTypes>
Enum that defines the various data types that can utilised within an SQL database. The types can have one, two or no parameters to define the details of their datatype (e.g: The maximum number of characters within a CHAR data type).

  • Nested Class Summary

  • Enum Constant Details

    • CHAR

      public static final SqlDataTypes CHAR
      A FIXED length string (can contain letters, numbers, and special characters). The size parameter specifies the column length in characters - can be from 0 to 255. Default is 1.

    • VARCHAR

      public static final SqlDataTypes VARCHAR
      A VARIABLE length string (can contain letters, numbers, and special characters). The size parameter specifies the maximum string length in characters - can be from 0 to 65535

    • BINARY

      public static final SqlDataTypes BINARY
      Equal to CHAR(), but stores binary byte strings. The size parameter specifies the column length in bytes. Default is 1

    • VARBINARY

      public static final SqlDataTypes VARBINARY
      Equal to VARCHAR(), but stores binary byte strings. The size parameter specifies the maximum column length in bytes.

    • TINYBLOB

      public static final SqlDataTypes TINYBLOB
      For BLOBs (Binary Large Objects). Max length: 255 bytes

    • TINYTEXT

      public static final SqlDataTypes TINYTEXT
      Holds a string with a maximum length of 255 characters

    • TEXT

      public static final SqlDataTypes TEXT
      Holds a string with a maximum length of 65,535 bytes

    • BLOB

      public static final SqlDataTypes BLOB
      For BLOBs (Binary Large Objects). Holds up to 65,535 bytes of data

    • MEDIUMTEXT

      public static final SqlDataTypes MEDIUMTEXT
      Holds a string with a maximum length of 16,777,215 characters

    • MEDIUMBLOB

      public static final SqlDataTypes MEDIUMBLOB
      For BLOBs (Binary Large Objects). Holds up to 16,777,215 bytes of data

    • LONGTEXT

      public static final SqlDataTypes LONGTEXT
      Holds a string with a maximum length of 4,294,967,295 characters

    • LONGBLOB

      public static final SqlDataTypes LONGBLOB
      For BLOBs (Binary Large Objects). Holds up to 4,294,967,295 bytes of data

    • BIT

      public static final SqlDataTypes BIT
      A bit-value type. The number of bits per value is specified in size. The size parameter can hold a value from 1 to 64. The default value for size is 1.

    • TINYINT

      public static final SqlDataTypes TINYINT
      A very small integer. Signed range is from -128 to 127. Unsigned range is from 0 to 255. The size parameter specifies the maximum display width (which is 255).

    • BOOL

      public static final SqlDataTypes BOOL
      Zero is considered as false, nonzero values are considered as true.

    • BOOLEAN

      public static final SqlDataTypes BOOLEAN
      Equal to BOOL.

    • SMALLINT

      public static final SqlDataTypes SMALLINT
      A small integer. Signed range is from -32768 to 32767. Unsigned range is from 0 to 65535. The size parameter specifies the maximum display width (which is 255).

    • MEDIUMINT

      public static final SqlDataTypes MEDIUMINT
      A medium integer. Signed range is from -8388608 to 8388607. Unsigned range is from 0 to 16777215. The size parameter specifies the maximum display width (which is 255).

    • INT

      public static final SqlDataTypes INT
      A medium integer. Signed range is from -2147483648 to 2147483647. Unsigned range is from 0 to 4294967295. The size parameter specifies the maximum display width (which is 255)

    • INTEGER

      public static final SqlDataTypes INTEGER
      Equal to INT(size)

    • BIGINT

      public static final SqlDataTypes BIGINT
      A large integer. Signed range is from -9223372036854775808 to 9223372036854775807. Unsigned range is from 0 to 18446744073709551615. The size parameter specifies the maximum display width (which is 255)

    • FLOAT

      public static final SqlDataTypes FLOAT
      A floating point number. MySQL uses the p value to determine whether to use FLOAT or DOUBLE for the resulting data type. If p is from 0 to 24, the data type becomes FLOAT(). If p is from 25 to 53, the data type becomes DOUBLE()

    • DOUBLE

      public static final SqlDataTypes DOUBLE
      A normal-size floating point number. The total number of digits is specified in size. The number of digits after the decimal point is specified in the d parameter

    • DECIMAL

      public static final SqlDataTypes DECIMAL
      An exact fixed-point number. The total number of digits is specified in size. The number of digits after the decimal point is specified in the d parameter. The maximum number for size is 65. The maximum number for d is 30. The default value for size is 10. The default value for d is 0.

    • DATETIME

      public static final SqlDataTypes DATETIME
      A date and time combination. Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss. The supported range is from '1000-01-01 00:00:00' to '9999-12-31 23:59:59'. Adding DEFAULT and ON UPDATE in the column definition to get automatic initialization and updating to the current date and time.

    • TIMESTAMP

      public static final SqlDataTypes TIMESTAMP
      A timestamp. TIMESTAMP values are stored as the number of seconds since the Unix epoch ('1970-01-01 00:00:00' UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss. The supported range is from '1970-01-01 00:00:01' UTC to '2038-01-09 03:14:07' UTC.

    • TIME

      public static final SqlDataTypes TIME
      A time. Format: hh:mm:ss. The supported range is from '-838:59:59' to '838:59:59'

    • YEAR

      public static final SqlDataTypes YEAR
      A year in four-digit format. Values allowed in four-digit format: 1901 to 2155, and 0000. MySQL 8.0 does not support year in two-digit format.

    • getDataType

      public String getDataType()
      Method for retrieving the string of the data type, for the purposes of adding to a query. This method is only for data types with no parameters.
      Returns:
      The string of a data type to be utilised in a database query.

    • getDataType

      public String getDataType(int sizeOrFractionalSecondPrecision)
      Method for retrieving the string of the data type, for the purposes of adding to a query. This method is only for data types with a singular parameter.
      Parameters:
      sizeOrFractionalSecondPrecision - The parameter of the data type.
      Returns:
      The string of a data type to be utilised in a database query.

    • getDataType

      public String getDataType(int size, int decimals)
      Method for retrieving the string of the data type, for the purposes of adding to a query. This method is only for data types with 2 parameters.
      Parameters:
      size - The parameter that denotes the maximum size of the data type that can be inputted into the table.
      decimals - The amount of decimal places to utilise for the data type that can be inputted into the table.
      Returns:
      The string of a data type to be utilised in a database query.
